title: Vehicle Ownership, Insurance & Collisions
objectives: Understand registration, title, and renewal basics and keep records up to date.
Explain California financial responsibility (insurance) requirements and proof.
Perform basic maintenance checks and keep safety equipment in working order.
Know what to do at a collision scene and how/when to report.
Reduce risk and legal issues by planning for emergencies and documentation.

lessons.title: Registration & Title Basics
content: Your vehicle must have a valid title and registration with current address on file. Display valid plates and stickers as required.

lessons.title: Renewals, Fees & Smog Checks
content: Renew on time to avoid penalties. Some vehicles require periodic emissions inspections based on state rules.

lessons.title: Coverage Types & Proof
content: California law requires financial responsibility, typically through liability insurance. Keep digital or paper proof available for law enforcement.

lessons.title: After a Collision: Reporting & SR Forms
content: If a collision meets reporting thresholds (e.g., injury, certain property damage), you must file required reports within the stateâ€™s timeframe.

lessons.title: Essential Maintenance
content: Check tires, brakes, fluids, lights, and wipers regularly. Address warning lights promptly and keep a maintenance log.

lessons.title: Safety Equipment & Emergency Kits
content: Functioning headlights, brake lights, mirrors, and horn are essential. Carry an emergency kit suited to your region and season.

lessons.title: Immediate Actions
content: Stop immediately, protect the scene if safe, and check for injuries. Call 911 for emergencies. Move vehicles out of travel lanes if minor and safe.

lessons.title: Exchange & Reporting
content: Exchange names, addresses, driver license numbers, license plates, and insurance details. Follow state timelines for reports.
